alert.note: Alert for Dodge; Olmsted; Wabasha (Minnesota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS LaCrosse (Southwestern Wisconsin, Southeastern Minnesota, and Northeast Iowa)
info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued January 12 at 3:10PM CST until January 13 at 6:00PM CST by NWS LaCrosse
info.description: ...Dangerous Winter Storm Peaking Now and into the Evening... .A complex winter storm continues to bring heavy snow to central and southwest Wisconsin into far northeast Iowa. Winds were also on the increase with blowing and drifting now becoming more of a problem across parts of Iowa...mainly southwest of Highway 52. Further northwest snow was not as heavy and snow amount forecasts have been lowered northwest of a line from Austin to Winona Minnesota to Medford Wisconsin. The Winter Storm Warning was replaced by an Advisory for much of that area. The winter storm will continue to bring snow, heaviest east and south of the La Crosse - Winona area through the evening before becoming lighter. Whiteout conditions will become more widespread near and southwest of Highway 52 in northeast Iowa and extreme southwest Wisconsin. Travel will become more dangerous after sunset with darkness and whiteout in blowing snow there as winds gust to 45 mph. Consider altering, delaying or even canceling travel plans through the evening. Bitterly cold air arrives as this storm system exits the area with wind chills of 20 to 30 below by Saturday night. ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 PM CST SATURDAY... * WHAT...Snow. Total snow accumulations of 3 to 7 inches. Winds gusting as high as 40 mph. * WHERE...Wabasha, Dodge and Olmsted Counties. * WHEN...Until 6 PM CST Saturday. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. Patchy blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. The hazardous conditions could impact the evening commute. The cold wind chills as low as 20 below zero could cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 30 minutes.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. Visit 511mn.org for road conditions.
